page.title: 08INKBERROW FIRST SCHOOL.
page.content: {Inkberrow First School}was built in 1851.It has been extended and now has 5 classrooms,cloakrooms,toilets,a kitchen,offices and the original hall. There is a teaching headmistress,four teachers,secretary and cleaners.Most of the children come from the village and outlying villages.School begins at 9 o'clock and ends at 3.30.Lunch is at mid-day.A village lady cooks about 70 meals.The rest of the children bring sandwiches. Three dinner ladies look after the children at playtime. The school uniform is yellow and grey. All subjects are taught by class teachers but emphasis is put on reading,writing and maths.Children can play violins and recorders.Clubs are held after school.These include football,country dancing,skittleball and gymnastics.A lollipop man helps children cross the road each day.
